sn3.1:8.2: BB has “fierce” for tejasi, which misses the point. It’s an allusion to the venomous bite, teja having roots in both “sharp” and “fiery”. This metaphor is the origin of the dragon’s fiery breath.
sn3.1:12.3: PTS dict gives this ref for pasu = cattle and pasava = offspring.
sn3.1:12.6: BB gives the doctrinally correct Buddhist explanation for this. But as it stands, the text reads as if the mendicant is exacting fiery vengeance with their psychic power.
